The Data Science Design Manual

This book is part of the Texts in Computer Science series and provides a comprehensive guide to data science design. It covers various topics such as data preprocessing, feature engineering, model selection, and more. The book is written by Steven S. Skiena, a professor at Stony Brook University, and was published in 2017.

Key Concepts:

  • Series editors
  • Book publication
  • Copyright information
  • data acquisition
  • evaluation
  • statistical analysis
